column2: IDAHO DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Idaho
column6: ID

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column6: apply the brake and slow down.
column8: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column6: Vehicles may only turn left.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 3. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Listen to heavy metal music.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 4. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Crossroad
column6: Lane change
column8: Merge

column2: 6. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column6: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column8: check your side and rear view mirrors.

column2: 7. BAC is expressed in:
column4: percentage of blood to alcohol.
column6: ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: AAI (Acute Alcohol Intoxication) level.

column2: 8. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: following a motorcycle.
column6: exiting a freeway.
column8: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 9. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
column4: toward the curb.
column6: away from the curb.
column8: in any direction.

column2: 10. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column6: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column8: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column10: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.

column2: 11. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column6: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: maintain a constant speed.
column10: drive with the flow of traffic.

column2: 12. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Lap and shoulder belt only
column6: Pumping brakes.
column8: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 13. This is:
column4: a side road sign.
column6: a merging traffic sign.
column8: a reduction of lanes sign.

column2: 14. Work zone signs:
column4: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column6: mean that road conditions will improve soon.
column8: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.
column10: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.

column2: 15. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column4: black and white.
column6: brown and white.
column8: green and white.

column2: 16. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column6: are easier for the driver to operate.
column8: require more space for turning movements.
column10: take longer than cars to stop.

column2: 17. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column6: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column8: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column10: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the right lane ends.
column6: the road ahead is narrow.
column8: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column10: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 19. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: there is a low place in the road.

column2: 20. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: try your emergency lights.
column6: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column8: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 21. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column8: look well down the road and far off to each side.

column2: 22. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column6: in school zones.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 23. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Come to a full stop
column6: Merging traffic ahead
column8: Proceed with caution

column2: 24. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Leave the road immediately.
column6: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Call an ambulance.
column10: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 25. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They are hard to see in traffic.
column6: They always have the right-of-way.
column8: They obey specific traffic laws.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian Crossing
column6: Multiple Turns
column8: Right lane closed

column2: 27. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: turn left into the one-way road.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.

column2: 28. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: respect the posted speed limit.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: be aware possible hazards ahead.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down or stop
column6: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles
column8: You must make a complete stop

column2: 30. These are:
column4: regulatory signs.
column6: miles-left signs.
column8: route signs.

column2: 31. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column6: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 32. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: at an intersection with a stop sign.
column6: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.
column8: where there is a red light.

column2: 33. This sign means:
column4: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
column6: Traffic signal ahead
column8: Emergency stop ahead
column10: The traffic signal ahead is out of order

column2: 34. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: You must pass the school bus.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: The bus is about to stop.
column10: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 35. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as a green light.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 36. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column8: they must stop immediately.
column10: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.

column2: 37. A flashing red light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column10: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 38. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: Marijuana.
column6: A cold remedy.
column8: Tranquilizers.

column2: 39. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column6: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column8: Near school zones.
column10: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 40. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: come to a complete stop.
